result.execSummary:
The defendant Nicholas P. Draszkiewicz was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possess Drug Paraphernalia, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.573(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Court costs paid in full from cash bond.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Defendant Nicholas P. Draszkiewicz in court with attorney Michael D Hughes.  Kristi S Tlusty appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Agreement placed on the record by Ms. Tlusty.  DE entered a plea of no contest to Ct. 2.  Plea colloquy.  Court found plea given freely, voluntarily, and intelligently; accepted plea; found DE guilty and ordered entry of JOC.  Brief arguments by counsel.  Brief statement by DE.  Court ordered payment of court costs and DNA surcharge.  Cash bond to be applied to these costs.  Upon successful completion of probation in case 13CF99 and successful completion of this sentence defendant may petition the court for expungement.
Plea/sentencing hearing on June 26, 2014 at 10:30 am.

Defendant Nicholas P. Draszkiewicz in court with attorney Michael D Hughes.  Kristi S Tlusty appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Waived further reading of complaint.  Matter shall settle with other pending cases schedule with Judge Russell on 06-26-2014.  Bond continued. Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for June 26, 2014 at 10:30 am.

*Defendant shall not leave the State of Wisconsin without prior notice to and written approval of the Court.  Must report to the Taylor County Sheriff's Office for Booking Procedure. Defendant shall not possess or consume any controlled substances without a valid prescription.

Kristi Tlusty appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant appeared in court in custody. Court found probable cause for the arrest. Court advised DE of possible charges and penalties. Court advised DE of right to attorney.  Notice of right to attorney given to defendant.  State requested a $3,000.00 signature bond and a $500.00  cash bond with conditions of:  comply with booking; not possess or consume any controlled substances without a valid prescription.  Court ordered bond with conditions as requested.   The state moved to start bond revocation proceedings in pending file 13CF99 - so ordered by the court.   Initial appearance set for 06/03/2014 at  1:00 p.m.
